std.name: Send an HTTP request
std.documentation: `std::send_http_request` makes an HTTP request to the given URL and exports the response.

inputs.name: url
inputs.documentation: The URL for the request. Supported schemes are http and https.

inputs.name: body
inputs.documentation: The request body as a string or json object.

inputs.name: method
inputs.documentation:
The HTTP Method for the request. 
Allowed methods are a subset of methods defined in RFC7231: GET, HEAD, and POST. 
POST support is only intended for read-only URLs, such as submitting a search.

inputs.name: timeout_ms
inputs.documentation: The request timeout in milliseconds.

inputs.name: headers
inputs.documentation: A map of request header field names and values.

outputs.name: response_body
outputs.documentation: The response body returned as a string.

outputs.name: status_code
outputs.documentation: The HTTP response status code.

evm.name: Sign EVM Contract Call Transaction
evm.documentation: The `evm::call_contract` action encodes a contract call transaction, signs it with the provided signer data, and broadcasts it to the network.

inputs.name: description
inputs.documentation: A description of the transaction.

inputs.name: rpc_api_url
inputs.documentation: The URL of the EVM API used to broadcast the transaction.

inputs.name: signer
inputs.documentation: A reference to a signer construct, which will be used to sign the transaction.

inputs.name: contract_address
inputs.documentation: The address of the contract being called.

inputs.name: contract_abi
inputs.documentation: The contract ABI, optionally used to check input arguments before sending the transaction to the chain.

inputs.name: function_name
inputs.documentation: The contract function to invoke.

inputs.name: function_args
inputs.documentation: The contract function arguments

inputs.name: amount
inputs.documentation: The amount, in WEI, to transfer.

inputs.name: type
inputs.documentation: The transaction type. Options are 'Legacy', 'EIP2930', 'EIP1559', 'EIP4844'. The default is 'EIP1559'.

inputs.name: max_fee_per_gas
inputs.documentation: Sets the max fee per gas of an EIP1559 transaction. This value will be retrieved from the network if omitted.

inputs.name: max_priority_fee_per_gas
inputs.documentation: Sets the max priority fee per gas of an EIP1559 transaction. This value will be retrieved from the network if omitted.

inputs.name: chain_id
inputs.documentation: The chain id.

inputs.name: nonce
inputs.documentation: The account nonce of the signer. This value will be retrieved from the network if omitted.

inputs.name: gas_limit
inputs.documentation: Sets the maximum amount of gas that should be used to execute this transaction. This value will be retrieved from the network if omitted.

inputs.name: gas_price
inputs.documentation: Sets the gas price for Legacy transactions. This value will be retrieved from the network if omitted.

inputs.name: confirmations
inputs.documentation: Once the transaction is included on a block, the number of blocks to await before the transaction is considered successful and Runbook execution continues. The default is 1.

outputs.name: tx_hash
outputs.documentation: The hash of the transaction.

outputs.name: logs
outputs.documentation: The logs of the transaction, decoded via any ABI provided by the contract call.

outputs.name: raw_logs
outputs.documentation: The raw logs of the transaction.

outputs.name: result
outputs.documentation: The result of simulating the execution of the transaction directly before its execution.

outputs.name: abi_encoded_result
outputs.documentation: The simulation result with ABI context for using in other function calls.

evm.name: Eth Call
evm.documentation: The `evm::eth_call` command simulates an Ethereum transaction using the `eth_call` RPC endpoint.

inputs.name: description
inputs.documentation: A description of the call.

inputs.name: rpc_api_url
inputs.documentation: The URL of the EVM API used to send the RPC request.

inputs.name: contract_address
inputs.documentation: The address of the contract being called.

inputs.name: contract_abi
inputs.documentation: The contract ABI, optionally used to check input arguments before sending the transaction to the chain.

inputs.name: signer
inputs.documentation: The address that will be used as the sender of this contract call.

inputs.name: function_name
inputs.documentation: The contract function to call.

inputs.name: function_args
inputs.documentation: The contract function arguments.

inputs.name: amount
inputs.documentation: The amount, in Wei, to send in the transaction.

inputs.name: type
inputs.documentation: The transaction type. Options are 'Legacy', 'EIP2930', 'EIP1559', 'EIP4844'. The default is 'EIP1559'. This value will be retrieved from the network if omitted.

inputs.name: max_fee_per_gas
inputs.documentation: Sets the max fee per gas of an EIP1559 transaction. This value will be retrieved from the network if omitted.

inputs.name: max_priority_fee_per_gas
inputs.documentation: Sets the max priority fee per gas of an EIP1559 transaction. This value will be retrieved from the network if omitted.

inputs.name: chain_id
inputs.documentation: The chain id.

inputs.name: nonce
inputs.documentation: The account nonce of the sender. This value will be retrieved from the network if omitted.

inputs.name: gas_limit
inputs.documentation: Sets the maximum amount of gas that should be used to execute this transaction. This value will be retrieved from the network if omitted.

inputs.name: gas_price
inputs.documentation: Sets the gas price for Legacy transactions. This value will be retrieved from the network if omitted.

outputs.name: result
outputs.documentation: The contract call result.

evm.name: Check Transaction Confirmations
evm.documentation: The `evm::check_confirmations` action polls the network until the provided `tx_hash` has been confirmed by `confirmations` blocks.

inputs.name: tx_hash
inputs.documentation: The transaction hash to check.

inputs.name: rpc_api_url
inputs.documentation: The URL of the EVM API used to poll for the transaction's inclusion in a block.

inputs.name: chain_id
inputs.documentation: The chain ID of the network to check the transaction on.

inputs.name: confirmations
inputs.documentation: Once the transaction is included on a block, the number of blocks to await before the transaction is considered successful and Runbook execution continues. The default is 1.

outputs.name: contract_address
outputs.documentation: The contract address from the transaction receipt.

outputs.name: logs
outputs.documentation: The decoded contract logs from the transaction receipt.

evm.name: Sign EVM Transaction
evm.documentation: The `evm::sign_transaction` command signs an EVM transaction.

inputs.name: description
inputs.documentation: A description of the transaction

inputs.name: transaction_payload_bytes
inputs.documentation: The unsigned transaction payload bytes.

inputs.name: signer
inputs.documentation: A reference to a signer construct, which will be used to sign the transaction payload.

outputs.name: tx_hash
outputs.documentation: The hash of the transaction.

inputs.name: description
inputs.documentation: A description of the transaction.

inputs.name: rpc_api_url
inputs.documentation: The URL of the EVM API used to broadcast the transaction.

inputs.name: signer
inputs.documentation: A reference to a signer construct, which will be used to sign the transaction.

inputs.name: recipient_address
inputs.documentation: The EVM address of the recipient.

inputs.name: amount
inputs.documentation: The amount to send, in WEI (1 ETH = 10^18 WEI).

inputs.name: type
inputs.documentation: The transaction type. Options are 'Legacy', 'EIP2930', 'EIP1559', 'EIP4844'. The default is 'EIP1559'.

inputs.name: max_fee_per_gas
inputs.documentation: Sets the max fee per gas of an EIP1559 transaction. This value will be retrieved from the network if omitted.

inputs.name: max_priority_fee_per_gas
inputs.documentation: Sets the max priority fee per gas of an EIP1559 transaction. This value will be retrieved from the network if omitted.

inputs.name: chain_id
inputs.documentation: The chain id.

inputs.name: nonce
inputs.documentation: The account nonce of the signer. This value will be retrieved from the network if omitted.

inputs.name: gas_limit
inputs.documentation: Sets the maximum amount of gas that should be used to execute this transaction. This value will be retrieved from the network if omitted.

inputs.name: gas_price
inputs.documentation: Sets the gas price for Legacy transactions. This value will be retrieved from the network if omitted.

inputs.name: confirmations
inputs.documentation: Once the transaction is included on a block, the number of blocks to await before the transaction is considered successful and Runbook execution continues. The default is 1.

outputs.name: tx_hash
outputs.documentation: The hash of the transaction.

evm.name: Coming soon

inputs.name: description
inputs.documentation: A description of the transaction

inputs.name: rpc_api_url
inputs.documentation: The URL of the EVM API used to broadcast the transaction.

inputs.name: chain_id
inputs.documentation: The chain id.

inputs.name: signer
inputs.documentation: A reference to a signer construct, which will be used to sign the transaction.

inputs.name: contract
inputs.documentation:
The contract to deploy. At a minimum, this should be an object with a key `bytecode` and the contract bytecode.
The abi field can also be provided to add type checking for the constructor arguments.
The `evm::get_contract_from_foundry_project` and `evm::get_contract_from_hardhat_project` functions can be used to retrieve the contract object.

inputs.name: initializer
inputs.documentation: An optional array of initializer functions + arguments to call on the contract that is deployed to the proxy contract.

inputs.name: constructor_args
inputs.documentation: The optional constructor arguments for the deployed contract.

inputs.name: create_opcode
inputs.documentation: The create opcode to use for deployment. Options are 'create' and 'create2'. The default is 'create2'.

inputs.name: create2
inputs.documentation: Options for deploying the contract with the CREATE2 opcode, overwriting txtx default options.

inputs.name: proxied
inputs.documentation: Deploys the contract via a proxy contract. The default is false.

inputs.name: proxy
inputs.documentation: Options for deploying the contract via a proxy contract, overwriting txtx default options.

inputs.name: amount
inputs.documentation: The amount, in WEI, to send with the deployment.

inputs.name: type
inputs.documentation: The transaction type. Options are 'Legacy', 'EIP2930', 'EIP1559', 'EIP4844'. The default is 'EIP1559'.

inputs.name: max_fee_per_gas
inputs.documentation: Sets the max fee per gas of an EIP1559 transaction. This value will be retrieved from the network if omitted.

inputs.name: max_priority_fee_per_gas
inputs.documentation: Sets the max priority fee per gas of an EIP1559 transaction. This value will be retrieved from the network if omitted.

inputs.name: nonce
inputs.documentation: The account nonce of the signer. This value will be retrieved from the network if omitted.

inputs.name: gas_limit
inputs.documentation: Sets the maximum amount of gas that should be used to execute this transaction. This value will be retrieved from the network if omitted.

inputs.name: gas_price
inputs.documentation: Sets the gas price for Legacy transactions. This value will be retrieved from the network if omitted.

inputs.name: expected_contract_address
inputs.documentation: The contract address that the deployment should yield. If the deployment does not yield this address, the action will fail. If this field is omitted, the any deployed address will be accepted.

inputs.name: confirmations
inputs.documentation: Once the transaction is included on a block, the number of blocks to await before the transaction is considered successful and Runbook execution continues. The default is 1.

inputs.name: verify
inputs.documentation: Indicates whether the contract should be verified after deployment. The default is `true`. Set this value to `false` to prevent verification event when `verifier` args are provided.

inputs.name: verifier
inputs.documentation: Specifies the verifier options for contract verifications.

outputs.name: tx_hash
outputs.documentation: The hash of the transaction.

outputs.name: abi
outputs.documentation: The deployed contract ABI, if it was provided as a contract input.

outputs.name: contract_address
outputs.documentation: The address of the deployed transaction.

outputs.name: logs
outputs.documentation: The logs of the transaction, decoded via any ABI provided by the contract call.

outputs.name: raw_logs
outputs.documentation: The raw logs of the transaction.

outputs.name: verification_results
outputs.documentation: The contract verification results, if the action was configured to verify the contract.

svm.name: Sign SVM Transaction
svm.documentation: The `svm::send_transaction` is used to sign a transaction and broadcast it to the specified SVM-compatible network.

inputs.name: description
inputs.documentation: A description of the transaction.

inputs.name: transaction_bytes
inputs.documentation: The transaction bytes to sign.

inputs.name: signers
inputs.documentation: A set of references to signer constructs, which will be used to sign the transaction.

inputs.name: signer
inputs.documentation: A reference to a signer construct, which will be used to sign the transaction.

outputs.name: signed_transaction_bytes
outputs.documentation: The signed transaction bytes.

svm.name: Process SVM Instructions
svm.documentation: The `svm::process_instructions` action encodes instructions, adds them to a transaction, and signs & broadcasts the transaction.

inputs.name: description
inputs.documentation: A description of the transaction.

inputs.name: instruction
inputs.documentation: The instructions to add to the transaction.

inputs.name: signers
inputs.documentation: A set of references to signer constructs, which will be used to sign the transaction.

inputs.name: commitment_level
inputs.documentation: The commitment level expected for considering this action as done ('processed', 'confirmed', 'finalized'). The default is 'confirmed'.

inputs.name: rpc_api_url
inputs.documentation: The URL to use when making API requests.

inputs.name: rpc_api_auth_token
inputs.documentation: The HTTP authentication token to include in the headers when making API requests.

outputs.name: signature
outputs.documentation: The transaction computed signature.

svm.name: Deploy SVM Program
svm.documentation: `svm::deploy_program` deploys a Solana program to the specified SVM-compatible network.

inputs.name: description
inputs.documentation: A description of the deployment action.

inputs.name: program
inputs.documentation: The Solana program artifacts to deploy.

inputs.name: payer
inputs.documentation: A reference to a signer construct, which will be used to sign transactions that pay for the program deployment. If omitted, the `authority` will be used.

inputs.name: authority
inputs.documentation: A reference to a signer construct, which will be the final authority for the deployed program.

inputs.name: commitment_level
inputs.documentation: The commitment level expected for considering this action as done ('processed', 'confirmed', 'finalized'). The default is 'confirmed'.

inputs.name: auto_extend
inputs.documentation: Whether to auto extend the program account for program upgrades. Defaults to `true`.

outputs.name: signatures
outputs.documentation: The computed transaction signatures, grouped by transaction type.

outputs.name: program_id
outputs.documentation: The program ID of the deployed program.

outputs.name: program_idl
outputs.documentation: The program ID of the deployed program.

svm.name: Send SOL
svm.documentation: The `svm::send_sol` action encodes a transaction which sends SOL, signs it, and broadcasts it to the network.

inputs.name: description
inputs.documentation: A description of the transaction.

inputs.name: amount
inputs.documentation: The amount to send, in lamports (1 SOL = 10^9 lamports).

inputs.name: recipient
inputs.documentation: The SVM address of the recipient.

inputs.name: signer
inputs.documentation: A reference to a signer construct, which will be used to sign the transaction.

inputs.name: commitment_level
inputs.documentation: The commitment level expected for considering this action as done ('processed', 'confirmed', 'finalized'). The default is 'confirmed'.

inputs.name: rpc_api_url
inputs.documentation: The URL to use when making API requests.

inputs.name: rpc_api_auth_token
inputs.documentation: The HTTP authentication token to include in the headers when making API requests.

outputs.name: signature
outputs.documentation: The transaction computed signature.

svm.name: Send Token
svm.documentation: The `svm::send_token` action encodes a transaction which sends the specified token, signs it, and broadcasts it to the network.

inputs.name: description
inputs.documentation: A description of the transaction.

inputs.name: amount
inputs.documentation: The amount of tokens to send, in base unit.

inputs.name: token
inputs.documentation: The program address for the token being sent. This is also known as the 'token mint account'.

inputs.name: recipient
inputs.documentation: The SVM address of the recipient. The associated token account will be computed from this address and the token address.

inputs.name: authority
inputs.documentation: The pubkey of the authority account for the token source. If omitted, the first signer will be used.

inputs.name: fund_recipient
inputs.documentation: If set to `true` and the recipient token account does not exist, the action will create the account and fund it, using the signer to fund the account. The default is `false`.

inputs.name: signers
inputs.documentation: A set of references to signer constructs, which will be used to sign the transaction.

inputs.name: commitment_level
inputs.documentation: The commitment level expected for considering this action as done ('processed', 'confirmed', 'finalized'). The default is 'confirmed'.

inputs.name: rpc_api_url
inputs.documentation: The URL to use when making API requests.

inputs.name: rpc_api_auth_token
inputs.documentation: The HTTP authentication token to include in the headers when making API requests.

outputs.name: signature
outputs.documentation: The transaction computed signature.

outputs.name: recipient_token_address
outputs.documentation: The recipient token account address.

outputs.name: source_token_address
outputs.documentation: The source token account address.

outputs.name: token_mint_address
outputs.documentation: The token mint address.

svm.example:
action "send_sol" "svm::send_token" {
    description = "Send some SOL"
    amount = svm::sol_to_lamports(1)
    signers = [signer.caller]
    recipient = "zbBjhHwuqyKMmz8ber5oUtJJ3ZV4B6ePmANfGyKzVGV"
    token = "3bv3j4GvMPjvvBX9QdoX27pVoWhDSXpwKZipFF1QiVr6"
    fund_recipient = true
}

svm.name: Deploy SVM Program Subgraph
svm.documentation:
`svm::deploy_subgraph` creates a live Graph QL database for your program.

This command takes a program ID to index, a block height to start indexing from, and a set of events to index.
This data is encoded as a request and sent to your surfnet (when deploying to localhost) or to the Surfpool cloud services (when deploying to devnet or mainnet).
When the request is received, the associated chain is indexed and the data is stored in a Graph QL database.

inputs.name: description
inputs.documentation: A description of the subgraph.

inputs.name: subgraph_name
inputs.documentation: The name of the subgraph. This defaults to the event name.

inputs.name: program_id
inputs.documentation: The ID of the program to index as a subgraph.

inputs.name: program_idl
inputs.documentation: The IDL of the program, used to decode the data to be indexed.

inputs.name: block_height
inputs.documentation: The block height to start indexing from.

inputs.name: event
inputs.documentation: A map of events to index in the subgraph.

svm.name: Setup Surfpool
svm.documentation:
`svm::setup_surfnet` can be used to configure a surfnet.

The current supported operations are to set account or token account data.
The `set_account` action can be used to set the lamports, owner, data, and executable fields of an account.
The `set_token_account` action can be used to set the amount, delegate, delegated amount, and close authority for a token account.

inputs.name: description
inputs.documentation: A description of the setup.

inputs.name: rpc_api_url
inputs.documentation: The URL to use when making API requests.

inputs.name: network_id
inputs.documentation: The ID of the network type. Can be `localnet`, `devnet`, or `mainnet-beta`.

inputs.name: set_account
inputs.documentation: The account data to set.

inputs.name: set_token_account
inputs.documentation: The token account data to set.

telegram.name: Send Telegram Message

inputs.name: description
inputs.documentation: A description of the call.

inputs.name: telegram_bot_api_token
inputs.documentation: Coming soon

inputs.name: telegram_chat_id
inputs.documentation: Coming soon

inputs.name: message
inputs.documentation: Message to send.

outputs.name: result
outputs.documentation: The contract call result.

inputs.name: description
inputs.documentation: A description of the call.

inputs.name: telegram_bot_api_token
inputs.documentation: Coming soon

outputs.name: result
outputs.documentation: The chat_id.
